examples: The present passage is important as bringing the regenerating work of the Holy Ghost into direct relation to the resurrection of the body as a forepromise of that final deliverance [...]

verbs.description: forepromise (third-person singular simple present forepromises, present participle forepromising, simple past and past participle forepromised)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To promise beforehand or in advance
examples: For so God did forepromise in the prophet Isaiah [chap. lxvi.], “ Behold, I will let p'eace into Jerusalem like a waterflood,” die. And in Psalm lxxi. “ In his time righteousness shall flourish, yea and abundance of peace," &c.
